channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Supreme Court rules Christian-focused RE taught in NI schools is unlawful
item.description: The Christian religious education taught in schools in Northern Ireland is unlawful, the UK Supreme Court has ruled.

item.title: 'There were tears,' says woman whose kidney saved young boy's life
item.description: Pilot Aly Coyle met six-year-old Xaviar, who received her kidney in a transplant earlier this year.

item.title: Man charged in connection with detective's shooting
item.description: The senior detective was off duty when he was shot several times at a sports complex in Omagh, County Tyrone.

item.title: SAS soldiers threaten legal action over legacy plans, says MP
item.description: Conservative MP Sir David Davis says the move is unprecedented in the history of the British Army.

item.title: Man charged with murder of mother and assault of father
item.description: David Gallagher, 25, of Shrewsbury Downs, Ballinlough, Cork has been charged with murdering his mother and with assault causing harm to his father.

item.title: Alcohol licensing recommendations rejected by Lyons
item.description: Communities Minister Gordon Lyons has rejected a number of changes to the rules around alcohol licensing recommended by an independent report.

item.title: Snow and ice warning in place for parts of Northern Ireland
item.description: Frequent wintry showers are expected to continue moving inland, bringing a further risk of snow and icy conditions.

item.title: Man on the run from NI prison jailed for fraud in US
item.description: Elijah Gavin, 29, is currently listed as being "unlawfully at large" from HMP Magilligan.

item.title: Vogue Williams and Tom Read Wilson enter TV jungle as I'm A Celebrity's late entrants
item.description: The late entrants' arrival was teased in Wednesday night's episode of the ITV show.

item.title: 'Traumatic wait' for women facing breast cancer diagnoses
item.description: Dr Jilly O'Hagan says she is "hugely concerned" after three patients in her surgery received a late cancer diagnosis.

item.title: Two police officers injured after car 'deliberately' rammed
item.description: Police say an 18-year-old male driver "deliberately drove" a van at a police vehicle.

item.title: QUB in new cross-border 'all island university' collaboration
item.description: Dundalk Institute of Technology will get university status and students will be awarded their certs through QUB.

item.title: Crewman missing off Donegal coast named by RFA
item.description: James Elliott was last seen when the RFA Tidesurge was near Tory Island, Donegal on 14 November.

item.title: Almost 200 paramilitary murals and memorials on public housing land
item.description: It comes amid calls for ministers to consider an audit of memorials on public land and to remove paramilitary imagery.

item.title: Two men arrested in connection with detective's shooting
item.description: Two men are arrested in connection with the attempted murder of Det Ch Insp John Caldwell in February 2023.

item.title: Scientists shedding light on an underground hero
item.description: Earthworms are a vital part of our ecosystem but little is known about them in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Waiting list money diverted to tackle health deficit, confirms minister
item.description: The health minister said money pledged to tackle waiting lists has been diverted to deal with the Department of Health's deficit.

item.title: 'Alarming decline' of insects in new bug splat survey
item.description: The invertebrate charity Bugslife says new figures show the number of flying insects has more than halved in the past five years.

item.title: 'Our friends died in a hotel crush - the seven-year legal wait hangs over us'
item.description: Family and friends of three teenagers who died at the Greenvale Hotel in 2019 say they feel "left in the dark" over legal delays in the case.

item.title: Secret of a long life? Whiskey, says 107-year-old war veteran
item.description: Norman Irwin, who is 107-years-old, was joined by his family and friends at his care home in Coleraine to celebrate.

item.title: Special school pupil doesn't understand why he is at home, mum says
item.description: More than 30 pupils at Sandelford Special School in Coleraine, County Londonderry, have had to be homeschooled for a week.

item.title: Disabled performers call for better backstage access
item.description: They say the arts sector, while "probably the most forward-thinking," does not have a full range of opportunities.

item.title: What happens next in the Presbyterian Church?
item.description: The sudden and unprecedented resignation of the moderator has left the church grappling with the scale of its own safeguarding failures.

item.title: Bumper year for breeding wader birds on Upper Lough Erne
item.description: Efforts by conservationists and farmers pay off as breeding waders have a good summer in Fermanagh.

item.title: How dinosaur fossils were found on an island with 'the wrong rocks'
item.description: Ireland is an unlikely candidate for dinosaur fossils but two were found on Islandmagee beach, two decades apart.

item.title: BBC Newsline signed summary
item.description: A signed summary of BBC Newsline.

item.title: Where can I see Christmas lights switch-ons in Northern Ireland?
item.description: It's six weeks to go until Christmas - where can you see the lights be switched on across Northern Ireland?

item.title: Safeguarding failings 'watershed moment' for church, child abuse expert says
item.description: "Serious and significant failings" in safeguarding within the Presbyterian Church between 2009 and 2022 were disclosed on Wednesday.

item.title: Some social care workers to miss out on healthcare pay offer
item.description: The Department of Health has confirmed some social care staff will not benefit from the recent pay offer.

item.title: How Ed Sheeran inspired the next generation with guitar donation
item.description: "We were told a musician would be coming, but we didn't know who. Then the door opened and Ed Sheeran appeared."

item.title: Puffins return to island for first time in at least 25 years
item.description: Puffins have been seen on the Isle of Muck off Antrim for the first time in at least 25 years

item.title: 'Being filmed giving CPR traumatised me and crash victim's family'
item.description: Fiona Ferris was filmed giving CPR to Dominic McGrath, who died after being hit by a bus in Newry last December.

item.title: From Brazil to Belfast - pupils hold their own COP30 event
item.description: The COP30 climate simulation negotiation brought pupils from 28 schools to Belfast Castle.

item.title: 'You don't know what you'll face' - nurse on domestic abuse training
item.description: Almost 30,000 domestic abuse incidents were recorded in Northern Ireland between June 2024 and 2025.

item.title: Derry flights and Newry theatre get a share of €50m Dublin funding
item.description: The Irish government announces funding for a flight between Londonderry and Dublin and money for a Newry theatre.

item.title: New cemetery on target for burials as old site nears full capacity
item.description: The 30-acre Mullenan City Cemetery will provide an additional 3,500 burial sites for the area.

item.title: Body-worn camera trial as hospital staff spat at and burnt with cigarettes
item.description: The Western Health and Social Care Trust says abuse of staff has increased by 27% over the last two years.

item.title: Nine police officers injured in 'appalling' assaults
item.description: Officers were punched, bitten, spat on and kicked in four separate incidents in Strabane and Derry.

item.title: Man sustains serious injuries in single-vehicle crash
item.description: A man was arrested at the scene of the crash on the Barony Road, between Omagh and Cookstown, on Sunday night.

item.title: One person injured in city centre fight
item.description: The police say a large group of young people were involved in clashes in Derry city centre in the early hours of Sunday.

item.title: 'Wee firecracker' Jenny Baird finishes third in Big Brother final
item.description: Jenny Baird, a 20-year-old makeup artist from Londonderry is a fan favourite in the Big Brother house.

item.title: Police say alleged homophobic assault did not happen
item.description: The police say their investigation into the reported attack on Derry's Peace Bridge has concluded and no crime took place.

item.title: Christmas market in Londonderry cancelled over safety concerns
item.description: Organisers of the market have raised safety concerns over a building which engineers fear may collapse.

item.title: Residents return home after pipe bombs made safe
item.description: The devices were found during an overnight security alert in the Galliagh area of Londonderry.

item.title: Bishop calls for unity after thefts of Remembrance items
item.description: Bishop Donal McKeown says he was saddened by recent thefts and damage to displays in Londonderry.

item.title: Disclosure of Omagh bombing material an 'on-going process'
item.description: The disclosure of material about the 1998 Omagh bombing remains an on-going process.

item.title: Remembrance poppy memorial thefts treated as sectarian hate crime
item.description: The items, commemorating people from the area who died in World War One, were stolen from the Fountain estate on Remembrance weekend.

item.title: Calls for investigation after assaults at youth Gaelic football match
item.description: Tyrone GAA says it is treating the matter "most seriously" as police appeal for information.

item.title: Child critical after serious crash involving lorry
item.description: Emergency services were called to the scene on the Boleran Road, between Coleraine, Limavady and Garvagh, shortly before 16:00 BST on Monday.

item.title: Two men injured in suspected homophobic attack
item.description: The men had made their way onto Derry's Peace Bridge on Saturday night when they were assaulted.

item.title: Farm shed fire kills hundreds of pigs
item.description: Firefighters responded to reports of a farm shed on fire at the Fyfin Road area of Newtownstewart.

item.title: Car burnt out in racially-motivated hate crime
item.description: It happened in the Irish Green Street area of the town in the early hours of Friday, police say.

item.title: Man dies after being struck by car
item.description: The man was pronounced dead at the scene following a collision near Grange Lane on Thursday.

item.title: Irish government approves plans to ban disposable vapes
item.description: The Republic of Ireland is set to follow Northern Ireland in banning the sale of single use vapes.

item.title: Vigils held for five young people killed in Louth crash
item.description: The vigils, at three gaelic football grounds, follow a fatal two-vehicle crash at Gibstown on Saturday.

item.title: Irish teacher Enoch Burke returns to prison after 'fanatical campaign'
item.description: The judge said that Mr Burke and members of his family had engaged in a "concerted attack" on the authority of the civil courts.

item.title: Woman dead and man seriously injured in stabbing
item.description: Police were called to reports of an assault at a house at Shrewsbury Downs in Ballinlough on Monday night.

item.title: 'To think we're going to school today and she won't be there'
item.description: The principal of the school where one of the young people who died in a road crash in County Louth taught says she was a "master of her craft".

item.title: Search for missing Royal Navy crew member stood down
item.description: The Royal Fleet Auxiliary (RFA) Tidesurge crew member was last seen at about 22:30 (local time) on Friday.

item.title: Irish Labour leader calls for border poll timeline
item.description: Ms Bacik made the call for a "unity referendum" in a speech during the party's annual conference on Saturday evening.

item.title: Pope Leo XIV appoints his first Irish bishop
item.description: Bishop Niall Coll of Ossory has been appointed as the new Bishop of Raphoe.

item.title: Sinn Féin member expelled after partner's far-right arrest
item.description: Sinn Féin's national spokesperson says the woman was expelled after "she failed to notify the party that her home was raided".

item.title: Fisherman dies after falling overboard in County Donegal
item.description: The incident happened at about 13:25 GMT near Arranmore on Tuesday.

item.title: Woman found guilty of murdering two men in 2014
item.description: Two men were found shot dead on Inchicup Island on Lough Sheelin, in 2014, five weeks after they went missing.

item.title: Ryanair scraps printed boarding passes to go fully digital
item.description: The airline is only accepting digital boarding passes from Wednesday.

item.title: Funeral of 20-year-old Irish man killed in Ukraine to take place
item.description: Alex Ryzhuk, who was born in Dublin to Ukrainian parents, had been serving alongside military forces when he went missing and was presumed dead.

item.title: Catherine Connolly becomes 10th president of Ireland
item.description: The Republic of Ireland's new president says "our actions today will shape the world our grandchildren will inherit".

item.title: Outgoing Irish president proved he was no pushover
item.description: As Michael D Higgins ends his 14-year stretch as Ireland's president, Enda McClafferty looks back at his defining moments.

item.title: Higgins leaves official residence on last day as Irish president
item.description: There were cheers as Michael D and Sabina Higgins left Áras an Uachtaráin which is located in Dublin's Phoenix Park.

item.title: Bird flu outbreak confirmed near Northern Ireland border
item.description: The Republic of Ireland's minister for agriculture, food and the marine confirms a further outbreak of highly pathogenic avian influenza H5N1.

item.title: DUP absence from Connolly inauguration 'not a snub'
item.description: Gavin Robinson was speaking after the party confirmed they would not send a representative to Catherine Connolly's inauguration on Tuesday.

item.title: 'Did you give a lift to a hitchhiker?' - appeal over 1995 Jo Jo Dullard disappearance
item.description: Josephine “Jo Jo” Dullard was 21 when she went missing from Moone in County Kildare in 1995.

item.title: Huge sense of pride to play Roy Keane in new film, says Cork actor
item.description: The film is based on the fallout between Roy Keane and Mick McCarthy during Ireland's 2002 World Cup preparations.
